name: Write to the Brain v2.1
description:
Sentinel Defense Program and Viktor 2.0s power counters as a kill-shot. Sensei or Project Wotan counters make the click cost too much for a Runner increasing the chances of a trace routine going off. Pared down to only one Cerebral and no Edge of Worlds in the final version.

For further discussion see my blog post: http://daman-asha.livejournal.com/30318.html

name: Blue Pill sans Blue v0.4
description:
Originally intending to explore Criminal viruses & Vamp, plus Medium runs on unrezzable R&D. Original design ra with Noise, switching to Whizzard because six blue viruses didn't merit losing the three recurring credits to trash SSCG.

For more detailed discussion see my blog post here: http://daman-asha.livejournal.com/30318.html Later variant simplified out the complex combo to run leaner and more focussed on R&D attack.

name: Rush Kit
Kit 2.0
Nasir Meidan V1.0
Nasir Meidan V2.1
Rush Kit 2.0
Kit Yogosaurus
Chaos Scavenge
Room Watcher
description: Search as soon as possible for your breakers and keyhole, so you can run to R&D, trash the agendas you find and score them from the archives.

name: Fast Adv or scorch ?
Nasir
description: Quick deck formation, just first what i get in mind.

name: It's a Trap!
description: Basically make them think it's a Beale, whether it's a trap, a 5/3, or actually a Beale. Power out the economy early and feel free to try 2 or even 3 remotes with advanceable cards. Once they're set up, usually scoring a Beale for 3-4 points is fine. If you see Infiltration, try finding Zaibatsu or just installing a bunch of cards and advancing twice.

name: Please Sir, may I have another?
description: Try to give them an agenda, and then either Dedicateds kill them or win with psychographics. Bernice/Muckraker/Ichi/Raven can give tags early, so can psycho a 5/3 early to give you an early edge. As soon as you can Jackson 3 good targets (usually Dedicated/Bernice/Psycho), generally a good idea to shuffle.

name: Supa Mill
description:
Latest revision of a deck ive been working on. The plan is somewhat simple, though executing with this deck can be tricky.

That said, it has performed very well, including going undefeated at a recent league night.

Both parasite and imp kill/mill at least 2 cards per play. This puts archives into play very early, and speeds up the game significantly, making the corp having to deal with more agendas in a shorter timeframe.

Djinn is a pretty critical card, as well as knight. This deck can run on very few credits, and wants to run aggressively to ensure the corp cant rez everything they want to.

Tends to give up an agenda early against certain archetypes, but it can use that time to ensure either R&D or remote lock is established.

name: Andromeda 2
Wholesale ICE
description: Using Bioroid Efficiency, Oversight AI and Howler the corp cheats out insurmountable ice, shutting the runner down in the early game.

name: C'mon, Feel The Noise!
description:
ICE destruction focus, with Keyhole goodness.

This deck is a beast! I've only been able to play 4-5 games with it but it's only lost to a super fast NBN deck. An early game Keyhole is murder! Overall I'm pretty happy with it. Like most Anarch decks the tricky part is speed and money. I'd prefer to have 3 clone chips but I had to switch to 3 pro contacts instead because that cards helps this deck so much, in both regards.

Any thoughts?

name: bring me his head
description: I want the runner dead, plain and simple. I have several ways to accomplish this. Inasmuch as it's possible get money and draw cards. Use the shutdowns to kill plascretes. Hope that he actually steals 1 or 2 agendas in one turn. Sea source him, then scorch him, whatever it takes to kill the filthy runner. This is purely theoretical, as GRNDL isn't yet in my hands. I would love to know what you think!

name: streethawke sillyness
description: My take on exile, would love feed back! This deck is nice and versatile, it can handle almost any situation with aplomb. It needs a bit of cash to to do crazy things mid run, but once its up and going it moves along nicely. Also as you know data sucker + parasite +src/clone chip = fun

name: Noise Keyhole
description:
Let swordsman ruin my day. Honestly though swordsman can't be everywhere and I have virus recursion. Classic style crypsis only noise, using stimhack, in conjunction with good econ and ice destruction bringing the pain with keyhole for a real mill-fest. This deck should turn Jackson Howard's gorgeous well-kept hair white. Stimhacks help to pay to steal agendas from servers, and get you in on a surprise. You should theoretically only need to steal 1 or 2 from a remote, the rest should come from archives/R&D...but theres also always HQ. This deck spreads the attack everywhere and slows down even the fastest of corps.

I will miss Imp though. Maybe I'll drop 1 keyhole for it, but really keyhole is the centerpiece here.

name: Professional Attack β
description: The beginning of an idea. Hasn't been tested yet.

name: Fast Adv or scorch ? v2
description:
Changed some thigs deck, I think I need more eco,

Added +1 Scorch +2 Freelancer +2 Melange +1 Elie (I love this card) + 2 Uroboros Removed - Shadow - Caduceus - Burke

Fast Adv + tag and Bag. I think about to add TGTBT agenda and remove Veteran Program. (Yea bad publicity risk).

Feel free to comment and rate !

name: Nothing personal
description: It will be quite some time before I can get my hands on him, but I could not resist the temptation to make a Nasir Meidan deck. Hopefully, the interactions between personal workshop, pheromones, stimhack and emergency shutdown are enough to keep the deck floating in credits.

name: Prometheus Returns
The Red Queen
What is this, I don't even
description:
I'll be the first to admit, that I don't get this guy at all. This is a post just to get things going on the discussion as I see it. That said, I feel like this is the "one shot" breakers type guy mentioned on sharpshooter. So, much like the general consesus is, his money is spent to summon breakers before the ice rez, and use the rez money to pay for the break. This means you need as efficient breakers as possible, and ways to make breaking cheap.

So, LLDS helps bring breakers up to strength while installing, and being cheap enough that you don't need piles of money 'just in case' you need to install something big. Makes me consider inti! Imagine installing inti on the fly and its str 4...or 6 if on dino.

Cyberfeeder helps add untouchable credits to the pool for breaking and boosting. Effectively shrinking the Str to cost to break ratio. Also, for this same reason, grappling hook helps you with multisub-expensive breakers.

Aesops is there to eat replicators since LLDS must be out early to help keep the insta-install break costs down. Also it synergizes with casts and breakers you suddenly don't need.

Essentially what this does is turns breakers into flickering breakers, to borrow from magic.

The downsides is it feels slow while you look for your breaker tutors. Maybe using more of an exile method of diesel/QT and FCC would be better, but I don't know, overdraw and dumping might be just as good.

name: Professional Attack β v0.1
description:
The beginning of an idea. Hasn't been tested yet.

  • Had to -1 Desperado +1 Same Old Thing

name: LLDS Madness v2.0
description:
A really crazy idea. Its a light eco deck because, after you're set, everything is almost free. Here is how it works.

First thing you want is a Replicator. After you install it, ALWAYS get another hardware copy, even useless one. It thins your deck and leaves what you need, and works beautifully with Capstone. After that get a LLDS and install all 3 of it.This is the base of your RIG so everytime you install an icebreaker, he will be with at least +3 str (Dino will make it +5). Do not be afraid to change your already installed Inti your ZU, scavenge em, test run it from the archives and next turn buy it and install them again. When every tutor is gone, go for Levy and stay using capstone to remove any useles card buy your icebreakers again. Scheherazade is great here. Its a beautiful thing have a 5 str faerie that gives you 1 cred. Feedback is always welcome.

name: Noise hard at work
description: Ok there is a lot of haters for Hard at Work (HaW). I think the card is pretty good and will get better when the new deluxe expansion comes out. Why? Run events like Early Bird are huge in this type of deck. The run events help to keep the pressure on the corp. Cool card interactions is you will always have money to run using any of the run events if you have HaW in play. Armitage is present to help burst your econ when you need it to install a breaker like Yog or the A.I. Surge found a place if the corp decides to clear virus and sneak an agenda by you.
